AvD_PostEA.synopsis:
Avatar attempts to rest on the first night, and reflects on what has happened on the nautiloid.

JLatino: Look at cinematic context for mocap direction

AvD.synopsis:
Avatar attempts to rest on the first night, and reflects on what has happened on the nautiloid.

JLatino: Look at cinematic context for mocap direction

AvD_PostEA_19.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_19.text: *Falling into your trance should have been as easy as breathing, yet peace eludes you.*

AvD_PostEA_201.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_201.text: *You picture the Feywild in its colourful glory, the joy of all seasons flourishing at once.*

AvD_PostEA_25.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_25.text: *Fire spills across your thoughts: dragon's breath. The tadpole slithers, twisting deeper into your skull.*

AvD_PostEA_239.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_239.text: *Your head is about to burst. The memory consumes your mind, corrupting the trance.*

AvD_PostEA_219.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_219.text: You have walked your dreams countless times before. Will this memory to pass.

AvD_PostEA_96.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_96.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: wild, glorious magic.*

AvD_PostEA_302.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_302.text: *As the trance stabilises, your breath deepens. Be it cure or cage, something must be done about the tadpole.*

AvD_PostEA_180.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_180.text: *Every night that passes is another night the monster inside you grows.*

AvD_PostEA_134.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_134.text: Refuse to break. Anything can be endured in the trance.

AvD_PostEA_150.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_150.text: *The flames fall away, a mere illusion. You are one with the Feywild again, agleam in revelry.*

AvD_PostEA_272.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_272.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*

AvD_PostEA_222.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_222.text: *Agony bursts behind your eyes, and the whole world goes dark.*
AvD_PostEA_222.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

AvD_PostEA_37.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_37.text: *You seek rest, but an active mind refuses you.*

AvD_PostEA_129.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_129.text: *Your mission should be your focus: finding a githyanki crèche, using a zaith'isk device to silence the ghaik parasite.*

AvD_PostEA_0.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_0.text: *Instead, recent memories overwhelm you: the kith'raki attacking the nautiloid; warring demons and devils; the twitching ghaik tadpole.*

AvD_PostEA_252.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_252.text: *Your head twinges. Is it the tadpole, you wonder? Had you imagined it - or were you soon to turn?*

AvD_PostEA_116.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_116.text: *'Suffering is not a curse, but a gift'. So Kith'rak Urlon had taught you.*

AvD_PostEA_111.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_111.text: *You will take this chance to overcome and ascend. Even the kith'raki will bow to you.*

AvD_PostEA_168.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_168.text: *Your thoughts turn to courage; a deep sleep soon follows.*

AvD_PostEA_182.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_182.text: *No exercise had prepared you for such extraordinary circumstances.*

AvD_PostEA_36.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_36.text: Imagine yourself beheading the very ghaik that had infected you.

AvD_PostEA_158.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_158.text: *You can almost feel its thick skull in your grasp, almost smell its silver blood clogging the air.*

AvD_PostEA_206.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_206.text: *You offer the head to Vlaakith, your queen. She hands you a sword of silver in return.*

AvD_PostEA_5.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_5.text: *Agitation overcomes imagination. Like it or not, the ghaik has bested you this day.*

AvD_PostEA_300.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_300.text: *You fall into fitful sleep, your dreams dominated by the blood-lakes of Hell and snarling ghaik.*

AvD_PostEA_283.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_283.text: Shut your mind to all thought.

AvD_PostEA_131.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_131.text: *You drive away all fears, and give yourself to the darkness. A deep sleep soon follows.*

AvD_PostEA_257.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_257.text: *There is no conquering the agitation. Like it or not, mind flayers have bested you this day.*

AvD_PostEA_53.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_53.text: I did it. After ten long years in the Hells, I'm fucking free.

AvD_PostEA_2.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_2.text: The air smells so much better here. And the breeze, and the trees, and the everything of it all. I could die now, and that'd be all right.

AvD_PostEA_226.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_226.text: *You can't hide it, even from yourself: you are deeply unsettled by that thing in your brain, and you haven't a clue how to cure it.*

AvD_PostEA_178.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_178.text: I'll figure something out. I always do.

AvD_PostEA_171.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_171.context: NodeContext: Yawning as she falls asleep reassuring herself.

AvD_PostEA_294.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_294.text: Uh, there was that one time with the three-tusked orthon...

AvD_PostEA_88.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_88.text: Will you leave that alone? It was five years ago, and the scar's almost healed.

AvD_PostEA_93.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_93.text: How do I turn you off? Oh wait, I know.
AvD_PostEA_93.context: NodeContext: Yawning as she falls asleep reassuring herself.

AvD_PostEA_43.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_43.text: While I'm at it, I better find a way to turn down this inferno blazing in my heart.

AvD_PostEA_273.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_273.text: Dammon seems to've made a good start. I ought to keep him close.

AvD_PostEA_293.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_293.text: Really close. And then, next time he leans in to listen to my heart, I take his chin in my hand and I lift his face to meet mine and I - stop it, brain! This isn't the time! Is it?

AvD_PostEA_115.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_115.text: So I take his chin in my hand and I lift his face to meet mine and his face softens, like he's seeing me for the first time. 'Karlach...' he says, straightening.

AvD_PostEA_210.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_210.text: He puts his hand over mine, steps closer to me. Hand on my waist now as he leans in and kisses me so softly, like he's savouring each sensation.

AvD_PostEA_264.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_264.text: His hand moves lower, and he pulls me even closer toward him. I'm all nerves now, all starry, as my head explodes, showering him with skull fragments to reveal a mass of tentacles - OH GODS!

AvD_PostEA_30.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_30.text: Retreat. Abort. Go back. Ugh - why?

AvD_PostEA_183.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_183.text: Don't you have enough to worry about? Go to sleep for fuck's sake.

AvD_PostEA_230.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_230.text: Fucking Zariel. Mutilated me before I even knew what was happening. But I'll have this bloody heart out. Or turned off. Or whatever.

AvD_PostEA_212.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_212.text: Then I'm horizontalling my way around Baldur's Gate, from halfling poet to goliath berserker, until the gods themselves step in.

AvD_PostEA_155.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_155.text: Better not to go there. Plenty of time to fantasise about the future once I'm sure I've got a future.

AvD_PostEA_157.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_157.text: O-ho yes. Let's paint a picture. A halfling, a barbarian, and Karlach...

AvD_PostEA_133.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_133.text: Sweet silver-tongued halfling perched on my lap - I'll have one hand up her skirt, she'll have one down my top, when there's a knock at the door.

AvD_PostEA_260.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_260.text: He doesn't wait for my reply - it's... Logus... and all ten feet of him are back from the hunt. He steadies a brace of rabbits against the wall and sees us tangled up when - wait! No! Brain! This isn't the time... is it?

AvD_PostEA_181.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_181.text: Logus saunters over to me and...Liza. We startle. Didn't know he'd be back so soon. 'Let's move this to the bedroom, he grumbles.'

AvD_PostEA_149.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_149.text: Liza nods. I smile. I hoist her into my arms, use my free arm to pull Logus in closer. I kiss his neck, slowly, as my face suddenly blows out and my six writhing tentacles latch around his - OH GODS!

AvD_PostEA_113.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_113.text: What if the gods aren't even real?

AvD_PostEA_233.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_233.text: I've got a lot of living to do from here on out. Better rest up.

AvD_PostEA_9.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_9.text: Yes. Rest. Sleep. Peace. Ugh, I don't want to sleep! I want to be alive!

AvD_PostEA_128.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_128.text: Can't wait to eat some roasted chicken. Stand on a sea cliff. Touch someone - oh gods! Touch!

AvD_PostEA_249.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_249.text: Do not go there, Karlach. Not unless you want to burn this camp down.

AvD_PostEA_253.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_253.text: Not quite. Got a mind flayer tadpole in the head to worry about, don't we?

AvD_PostEA_103.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_103.text: A minor inconvenience. I'll find a way to get it removed.

AvD_PostEA_66.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_66.text: I'm never going back. Not for anything, not ever.

AvD_PostEA_23.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_23.text: Fuck no I'm not. I've suffered enough for five Karlachs - and I've had enough.

AvD_PostEA_97.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_97.text: *Rest eludes you as you stare at the wrong side of the stars.*

AvD_PostEA_86.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_86.text: *The ghaik larva is curled up in your skull, no doubt pleased with itself.*

AvD_PostEA_151.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_151.text: *Without a cure, you cannot restore your honour before your queen, Vlaakith.*

AvD_PostEA_27.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_27.text: Contemplate peace. Death can be sought in battle if purification is too far.

AvD_PostEA_205.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_205.text: *You picture a silver blade cleaving through ghaik and their thralls, one after another.*

AvD_PostEA_101.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_101.text: *Every cut is meditation. It reshapes the world to Vlaakith's will.*

AvD_PostEA_213.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_213.text: *Sleep comes as you count the fields of the dead, soon to grow.*

AvD_PostEA_78.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_78.text: *Every day this abomination is in your head, you put others at risk.*

AvD_PostEA_203.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_203.text: *There is no peace in that truth, only an unease that steals away any chance of sleep.*

AvD_PostEA_309.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_309.text: Rage fills you. Turn the feeling to higher purpose.

AvD_PostEA_89.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_89.text: *Every abomination would be gutted and burned to ash.*

AvD_PostEA_223.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_223.text: *Your anger is clarifying, pure and bright. It burns away all doubt.*

AvD_PostEA_7.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_7.text: *As the fire settles, tension bleeds from your body.*

AvD_PostEA_189.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_189.text: *Tomorrow, you will fight harder than ever before.*

AvD_PostEA_214.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_214.text: *You have been enslaved like your ancestors! Rage sparks to hatred.*

AvD_PostEA_91.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_91.text: *It burns relentlessly, like a red dragon's breath scorching you from the inside out.*

AvD_PostEA_38.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_38.text: *Stripped raw and restless, you find no peace that night.*

AvD_PostEA_231.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_231.text: Shame claws at you like rot. Are you a failure?

AvD_PostEA_217.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_217.text: *No. You would only be a failure if you stop fighting.*

AvD_PostEA_274.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_274.text: *Your honour can be restored before Vlaakith. It would be restored.*

AvD_PostEA_58.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_58.text: *Resolve strengthened, you fall into a deep slumber.*

AvD_PostEA_224.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_224.text: *You have prepared all your life to fight the ghaik. You dream of presenting one of their vile heads to Vlaakith in Tu'narath!*

AvD_PostEA_191.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_191.text: *How were you caught off-guard on the nautiloid? What was the crucial mistake?*

AvD_PostEA_170.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_170.text: *Without answers, you lay haunted for the rest of the night.*

AvD_PostEA_177.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_177.text: *As you writhe with sickly dreams, a deep dread floods you.*
AvD_PostEA_177.context: CinematicNodeContext: Restlessly, the Dark Urge keeps tossing and fretting in their bed.

AvD_PostEA_45.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_45.text: *Though you have a tadpole, you know your broken mind is not like the others who bear the worm.*

AvD_PostEA_21.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_21.text: *A few scraps of the past come back to you now and then, but you can never quite tell where the knowledge comes from.*

AvD_PostEA_54.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_54.text: *Inexplicable violent yearnings overwhelm all other thoughts. Who could you possibly be, to be their vessel?*

AvD_PostEA_308.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_308.text: Think upon your heritage - is there truth hidden there?

AvD_PostEA_235.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_235.text: *The ancestral knowledge of your dragon-clan is diluted amid the liquid hate in your blood.*

AvD_PostEA_100.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_100.text: *Images of the Underdark's famed torments sometimes flicker in your head, but your place amongst your kin seems long-lost.*

AvD_PostEA_10.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_10.text: *Do you feel jolly? Aren't you meant to feel jolly? You don't make a very good gnome.*

AvD_PostEA_185.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_185.text: *It must have been a very long time since you were among your kind.*

AvD_PostEA_61.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_61.text: *When you try to think of a home your mind twists itself back to indulge in the delights of the day.*

AvD_PostEA_132.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_132.text: *You have been fighting since birth, such as Vlaakith preaches, but you feel little connection to any crèche. Barely a call to your queen.*

AvD_PostEA_121.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_121.text: *The comforts of the mine, a simple life, somehow you doubt you led. They don't call to you.*

AvD_PostEA_79.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_79.text: *The magma of Hell's knowledge sometimes bubbles up in your brain's crater, but never reaches a true fire.*

AvD_PostEA_237.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_237.text: *Your kinsfolk are found everywhere, aren't they? It doesn't narrow much down.*

AvD_PostEA_312.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_312.text: Contemplate your craft - why do you have the skills you do?

AvD_PostEA_94.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_94.text: *The oath you awoke with is some faded instinct. What does it even stand for?*

AvD_PostEA_62.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_62.text: *Nature provides some soft comforts, but your draw to it is only some faded instinct.*

AvD_PostEA_31.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_31.text: *The call to song is a hollow joy. You are more suited to death's dirge.*

AvD_PostEA_127.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_127.text: *All your education, your knack for your spells is only present as some distant instinct.*

AvD_PostEA_120.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_120.text: *The rages in your heart arise as an ancient instinct - your skill in the fray is but a long-lost muscle memory.*

AvD_PostEA_186.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_186.text: *Though you know how to call to order, hold a line and wield a blade, you are doing so out of habit and a forgotten instinct.*

AvD_PostEA_70.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_70.text: *The worship of your God feels an ancient fool's errand you are only following out of habit. When you call to the skies, there is no answer.*

AvD_PostEA_238.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_238.text: *You are fortunate your sorceries come from your instincts and not your mangled head.*

AvD_PostEA_6.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_6.text: *Whatever deal you made with your patron still stands, but they are in your magics, not in your mind.*

AvD_PostEA_98.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_98.text: *The lingering traces of your battle-intuitions are there. But the sly Urge within calls you to use them for harm.*

AvD_PostEA_118.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_118.text: *For a monk, you do hyperventilate an awful lot.*

AvD_PostEA_277.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_277.text: *The frost of the mountain, the sand of the beach, the mulch of the swamp. There are hints of the trails left. But they are far away.*

AvD_PostEA_161.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_161.text: *A friend of daggers all your skills match those of a hot-blooded killer.*

AvD_PostEA_284.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_284.text: Probe your mind - what thoughts stand out the most?

AvD_PostEA_275.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_275.text: The answer is simple: you must be Death itself.

AvD_PostEA_136.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_136.text: *There are many, many more kills ahead of you. That is you. A killer.*

AvD_PostEA_75.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_75.text: *You recall waking up hearing the pounding war drum of blood.*

AvD_PostEA_42.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_42.text: *How much you treasured the sight of the first corpse you touched.*

AvD_PostEA_207.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_207.text: *The crack of that guard's twice-broken legs.*

AvD_PostEA_311.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_311.text: *The delicacy of the jay's severed wings.*

AvD_PostEA_135.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_135.text: *The waggling stump you left of that wizard's arm...*

AvD_PostEA_188.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_188.text: Swear to resist these sick Urges, whatever the cost.

AvD_PostEA_16.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_16.text: *There must be a way through this red fog.*

AvD_PostEA_278.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_278.text: Lean deeper into your foul imaginations.

AvD_PostEA_192.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_192.text: *Your body feels aroused imagining a broken twisted neck, and a thrill thinking of a trailing intestine.*

AvD_PostEA_71.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_71.text: *As these images flood your mind, you fall soundly asleep like a babe in arms.*
AvD_PostEA_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: DU falls asleep/trances if elf

AvD_PostEA_202.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_202.text: Wonder - why are these memories so beautiful?

AvD_PostEA_290.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_290.text: *How cruel your old life must have been. What could have happened to make you forget?*

AvD_PostEA_276.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_276.text: Fret - there is worse in your head than a tadpole.

AvD_PostEA_41.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_41.text: *Instinct tells you, you must protect yourself from you. Discover yourself, before it is too late.*

AvD_PostEA_82.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_82.text: *As you fall asleep, you are a shivering and shaking mess.*
AvD_PostEA_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: DU falls asleep/trances if elf

AvD_PostEA_154.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_154.text: The answer is bleak: you were once someone awful.

AvD_PostEA_241.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_241.text: *Gazing up at the night sky, you try to will yourself to sleep.*

AvD_PostEA_292.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_292.text: *Useless - you can't stop thinking of Shar's sacred mission.*

AvD_PostEA_267.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_267.text: *Protect the artefact. Find your contact in Baldur's Gate. Fulfil Shar's command.*

AvD_PostEA_117.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_117.text: Reach for the artefact, hidden among your belongings.

AvD_PostEA_269.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_269.text: *Its weight reassures you. Shar's will and your destiny, right in your grasp.*

AvD_PostEA_173.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_173.text: *So many brothers and sisters sacrificed for it. Only you remain.*

AvD_PostEA_187.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_187.text: *... you and the vile creature inside you. The mere thought of it makes you shiver.*

AvD_PostEA_56.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_56.text: *You have to rid yourself of the tadpole. Shar herself is counting on you.*

AvD_PostEA_216.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_216.text: *If sleep won't come to you, at least darkness will.*

AvD_PostEA_138.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_138.text: Shut your eyes and silently thank Shar for the night's beauty.

AvD_PostEA_199.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_199.text: *You hear only your own thoughts. Shar's presence won't come to you - why?*

AvD_PostEA_33.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_33.text: *You have fulfilled her will - retrieved the artefact for her. Everyone has perished but you.*

AvD_PostEA_102.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_102.text: *... you, and your parasite. You are tainted now. Imperfect.*

AvD_PostEA_124.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_124.text: *You have to rid yourself of the tadpole. Then Shar will come to you - honour you as you honour her.*

AvD_PostEA_289.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_289.text: Pray to Shar. Her blessing will help you weather the trials ahead.

AvD_PostEA_67.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_67.text: *Only the sounds of the wilderness answer.*

AvD_PostEA_243.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_243.text: Try to remember what came before the mission.

AvD_PostEA_251.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_251.text: *Your memories are foggy - as your mission requires them to be: Shar's secrets are precious.*

AvD_PostEA_105.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_105.text: *As precious as sleep, and the night's oblivion.*

AvD_PostEA_167.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_167.text: Let your thoughts turn to the crash.

AvD_PostEA_172.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_172.text: *... all nothing compared to what came before. Compared to the tadpole.*

AvD_PostEA_228.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_228.text: *It's still inside you. Does it watch the night sky even now, through your eyes?*

AvD_PostEA_144.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_144.text: *You have to get rid of it. You have to survive. You are the only one left to ensure Shar's glory.*

AvD_PostEA_261.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_261.text: *The dark is familiar, but not comforting. It is a struggle to sink into your trance, weaving together memory, ambition, and purpose.*

AvD_PostEA_8.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_8.text: *You picture a cup, ancient and elven: priceless. Drinking from it honours the dead - those lost to Lolth's predation.*

AvD_PostEA_153.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_153.text: *Fire spills across your thoughts: dragon's breath. The tadpole slithers, twisting deeper into your skull.*

AvD_PostEA_190.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_190.text: *Your head is about to burst. The memory consumes your mind, corrupting the trance.*

AvD_PostEA_268.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_268.text: You have walked your dreams countless times before. Will this memory to pass.

AvD_PostEA_166.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_166.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: blood and darkness.*

AvD_PostEA_204.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_204.text: Refuse to break. Anything can be endured in the trance.

AvD_PostEA_77.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_77.text: *The fire fades, a meaningless distraction. You hold the cup again, ignoring the crack along its belly, and drink.*

AvD_PostEA_123.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_123.text: *As the trance stabilises, your breath deepens. Be it cure or cage, something must be done about the tadpole.*

AvD_PostEA_81.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_81.text: *Every night that passes is another night the monster inside you grows.*

AvD_PostEA_280.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_280.text: *The flames fall away, a mere illusion. You sit the dark again, beside Lolth's majesty.*

AvD_PostEA_143.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_143.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*

AvD_PostEA_240.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_240.text: *Agony bursts behind your eyes, and the whole world goes dark.*

AvD_PostEA_20.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_20.text: *The vision in your mind is simple: a stone altar to Lolth, the knife upon it bloody with sacrifice.*

AvD_PostEA_285.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_285.text: *A calm night is a mercy, yet your eyes refuse to stay closed.*

AvD_PostEA_3.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_3.text: *Every time they flicker shut, the tadpole seems to twitch behind them.*

AvD_PostEA_46.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_46.text: *Dragons, gith, and the Hells themselves have come after you. Yet it is this creature that lingers in your skull.*

AvD_PostEA_184.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_184.text: Focus. Finding a cure is all that matters.

AvD_PostEA_83.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_83.text: *And you will find it, no matter the cost.*

AvD_PostEA_288.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_288.text: *Your life is your own. No wriggling tadpole is going to change that.*

AvD_PostEA_296.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_296.text: *Sleep claims you, determination buoyed by gentle dreams.*

AvD_PostEA_194.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_194.text: You have to learn to control the tadpole. You sense it can grant you powers.

AvD_PostEA_297.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_297.text: *All you have to do is turn the tables - cage the creature before it cages you.*

AvD_PostEA_122.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_122.text: *You wonder if it could hear these thoughts - if it knows you're planning a rebellion.*

AvD_PostEA_68.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_68.text: *Let it listen. You will dream of all the ways to make this power your own.*

AvD_PostEA_200.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_200.text: Force the tadpole out of your mind. Think of home instead.

AvD_PostEA_271.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_271.text: *You belong with your people, down in the dark that never fades.*

AvD_PostEA_139.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_139.text: *Your people have survived the drow, the duergar, and every monster the Underdark has to offer. A mind flayer is nothing.*

AvD_PostEA_28.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_28.text: *Under the strange and open sky, sleep claims you.*

AvD_PostEA_195.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_195.text: *Yet the tadpole is in the dark too. Dozens of them, crawling towards you as a mind flayer held your skull in its psionic grip.*

AvD_PostEA_47.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_47.text: *Disgust churns deep in your stomach, leaving you resigned to a night without sleep.*

AvD_PostEA_73.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_73.text: Force the tadpole out of your mind. Think of home instead.

AvD_PostEA_34.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_34.text: *Baldur's Gate feels almost like a dream, after everything that has happened to you.*

AvD_PostEA_50.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_50.text: *Yet it is a dream of hope. You may be countless miles away, but it isn't an impossible journey.*

AvD_PostEA_59.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_59.text: *You will see those gates again. That promise sinks deep into your heart as your eyes drift shut.*

AvD_PostEA_104.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_104.text: *Except all you can picture is citizens with their skulls splintering open, tentacles sprouting from broken mouths.*

AvD_PostEA_140.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_140.text: *Their empty, alien eyes haunt you through a night of fitful sleep.*

AvD_PostEA_146.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_146.text: The tadpole influences you. Perhaps you might influence it in return...

AvD_PostEA_303.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_303.text: *You focus on that spot of pain from when it slipped behind your eye, to where it now lurks.*

AvD_PostEA_298.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_298.text: *You cannot prod it, but you can make it clear that you are watching. What is there to fear when it is the one stuck inside you?*

AvD_PostEA_196.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_196.text: *It is a minor victory, but enough to soothe you to sleep.*

AvD_PostEA_193.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_193.text: *The thought is punished by a spike of pain driven right between your eyes.*

AvD_PostEA_291.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_291.text: *The agony refuses to fade until you collapse against your bedroll in a cold sweat.*

AvD_PostEA_301.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_301.text: *You try to rest, but your mind won't settle.*
AvD_PostEA_301.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lying on his side, turns to lie on back

AvD_PostEA_307.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_307.text: *Just yesterday you were seducing a young noble, luring him to your master's lair.*

AvD_PostEA_107.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_107.text: *Today? You'd been kidnapped by mind flayers, chased through Hell by dragons, and thrown out of a burning ship.*

AvD_PostEA_137.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_137.text: *And you felt the sun on your skin...*

AvD_PostEA_295.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_295.text: Recall the light's comforting warmth. It's been an eternity.

AvD_PostEA_125.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_125.text: *You wonder if your ability to walk in the sun is a side effect of the tadpole the mind flayer put in your eye. It must be?*

AvD_PostEA_32.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_32.text: *All you know for sure is, given time, it will turn you into one of them.*

AvD_PostEA_80.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_80.text: *Getting rid of the tadpole will mean returning to the darkness. Unless...*

AvD_PostEA_51.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_51.text: *... unless you understand it. Master it. Which means finding an expert.*

AvD_PostEA_74.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_74.text: Focus on the problem - who would know the most about this?

AvD_PostEA_229.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_229.text: *You mentally shuffle through places likely to have an expert in mind flayers. Candlekeep? Neverwinter? Menzoberranzan? Baldur's Gate...*

AvD_PostEA_159.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_159.text: *Baldur's Gate is close to your master's coven, but also home to amazing scholars. Still, that's a problem for the morning.*
AvD_PostEA_159.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

AvD_PostEA_152.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_152.text: *You try to focus, but all you can see are the menacing eyes of a mind flayer.*

AvD_PostEA_248.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_248.text: Roll over, push it all from your mind.

AvD_PostEA_90.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_90.text: *You think on the day. The sunshine. Being alive - more or less.*

AvD_PostEA_85.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_85.text: *Despite everything, you relax into peaceful meditation, satisfied with all that's happened. Perhaps you wouldn't sleep so well if you knew what was coming.*

AvD_PostEA_110.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_110.text: Close your eyes. Relax. Imagine dragging your old master into the sunlight.

AvD_PostEA_64.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_64.text: *You smile, meditating on the flames that engulf his cruel face.*
AvD_PostEA_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

AvD_PostEA_244.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_244.text: *You close your eyes and try to focus on his delightful screams, but they quickly turn into your own. They only stop when tentacles burst from your mouth.*

AvD_PostEA_246.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_246.text: *You shudder, resigning yourself to whatever dark rest awaits you.*

AvD_PostEA_69.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_69.text: Think about your master. He'll be furious you didn't bring him dinner.

AvD_PostEA_263.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_263.text: *He'll believe you if you tell him what happened. But he won't forgive.*

AvD_PostEA_87.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_87.text: *Of course - you might already be a mind flayer by the time you return to Cazador.*

AvD_PostEA_163.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_163.text: *You could try getting rid of the tadpole, but that probably means returning to the darkness. Unless...*

AvD_PostEA_287.speaker: Player
AvD_PostEA_287.text: Consider the tadpole. Can a vampire spawn even become a mind flayer?

AvD_PostEA_99.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_99.text: *The worm in your head might not even have an appetite for undead meat.*

AvD_PostEA_270.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_270.text: *Until you know more about the tadpole, you can't be sure how much danger you're in.*

AvD_PostEA_12.speaker: Narrator
AvD_PostEA_12.text: *You have to understand it. Master it. Which means you need to find an expert.*

AvD_13.speaker: Narrator
AvD_13.text: *Falling into your trance should have been as easy as breathing, yet peace eludes you.*

AvD_143.speaker: Narrator
AvD_143.text: *You picture the Feywild in its colourful glory, the joy of all seasons flourishing at once.*

AvD_18.speaker: Narrator
AvD_18.text: *Fire spills across your thoughts: dragon's breath. The tadpole slithers, twisting deeper into your skull.*

AvD_168.speaker: Narrator
AvD_168.text: *Your head is about to burst. The memory consumes your mind, corrupting the trance.*

AvD_156.speaker: Player
AvD_156.text: You have walked your dreams countless times before. Will this memory to pass.

AvD_71.speaker: Narrator
AvD_71.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: wild, glorious magic.*

AvD_217.speaker: Narrator
AvD_217.text: *As the trance stabilises, your breath deepens. Be it cure or cage, something must be done about the tadpole.*

AvD_127.speaker: Narrator
AvD_127.text: *Every night that passes is another night the monster inside you grows.*

AvD_93.speaker: Player
AvD_93.text: Refuse to break. Anything can be endured in the trance.

AvD_106.speaker: Narrator
AvD_106.text: *The flames fall away, a mere illusion. You are one with the Feywild again, agleam in revelry.*

AvD_195.speaker: Narrator
AvD_195.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*

AvD_158.speaker: Narrator
AvD_158.text: *Agony bursts behind your eyes, and the whole world goes dark.*
AvD_158.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

AvD_29.speaker: Narrator
AvD_29.text: *You seek rest, but an active mind refuses you.*

AvD_0.speaker: Narrator
AvD_0.text: *Images overwhelm you: the kith'raki attacking the nautiloid; warring demons and devils; the twitching ghaik tadpole.*

AvD_181.speaker: Narrator
AvD_181.text: *Your head twinges. Is it the tadpole, you wonder? Had you imagined it - or were you soon to turn?*

AvD_83.speaker: Narrator
AvD_83.text: *'Suffering is not a curse, but a gift'. So the varsh had taught you.*

AvD_81.speaker: Narrator
AvD_81.text: *You will take this chance to overcome and ascend. Even the kith'raki will bow to you.*

AvD_122.speaker: Narrator
AvD_122.text: *Your thoughts turn to courage; a deep sleep soon follows.*

AvD_128.speaker: Narrator
AvD_128.text: *No exercise had prepared you for such extraordinary circumstances.*

AvD_28.speaker: Player
AvD_28.text: Imagine yourself beheading the very ghaik that had infected you.

AvD_112.speaker: Narrator
AvD_112.text: *You can almost feel its thick skull in your grasp, almost smell its silver blood clogging the air.*

AvD_147.speaker: Narrator
AvD_147.text: *You offer the head to Vlaakith, your queen. She hands you a sword of silver in return.*

AvD_4.speaker: Narrator
AvD_4.text: *Agitation overcomes imagination. Like it or not, the ghaik has bested you this day.*

AvD_215.speaker: Narrator
AvD_215.text: *You fall into fitful sleep, your dreams dominated by the blood-lakes of Hell and snarling ghaik.*

AvD_202.speaker: Player
AvD_202.text: Shut your mind to all thought.

AvD_92.speaker: Narrator
AvD_92.text: *You drive away all fears, and give yourself to the darkness. A deep sleep soon follows.*

AvD_186.speaker: Narrator
AvD_186.text: *There is no conquering the agitation. Like it or not, mind flayers have bested you this day.*

AvD_34.speaker: Narrator
AvD_34.text: *Warm air; rustling leaves. A perfect night to sleep under the stars.*

AvD_162.speaker: Narrator
AvD_162.text: *A shame your mind has other ideas.*

AvD_52.speaker: Narrator
AvD_52.text: *One moment, you'd been bartering with Mizora for freedom. The next, whisked away by tentacle monsters.*

AvD_14.speaker: Player
AvD_14.text: Put Mizora out of your mind. A cure for this tadpole is your top priority.

AvD_119.speaker: Narrator
AvD_119.text: *You imagine your fingers contorting into claws, and your skin rippling and bulging.*

AvD_9.speaker: Narrator
AvD_9.text: *You are the Blade of Frontiers. You'd conquered bugbears and banshees! You'd conquer this challenge, too.*

AvD_26.speaker: Narrator
AvD_26.text: *You clench your eyes tighter and search for sleep in the darkness.*

AvD_206.speaker: Player
AvD_206.text: Think back to the abduction. What do these creatures want with you?

AvD_51.speaker: Narrator
AvD_51.text: *To make you one of them, of course. Isn't that what mind flayers always want?*

AvD_227.speaker: Narrator
AvD_227.text: *A simple explanation. And wrong, you wager.*

AvD_178.speaker: Narrator
AvD_178.text: *Are you such precious cargo that they'd race through the Hells' bowels to protect you?*

AvD_171.speaker: Narrator
AvD_171.text: *Devils and demons swarm your thoughts. Soon, they will be swarming your dreams.*

AvD_20.speaker: Player
AvD_20.text: Let your mind drift to Mizora. What would it take for her to break your pact?

AvD_131.speaker: Narrator
AvD_131.text: *What was it Mizora had said? Oh yes - 'Over your rotting corpse'.*

AvD_182.speaker: Narrator
AvD_182.text: *You'd do anything to be a great hero - or so you once thought.*

AvD_85.speaker: Narrator
AvD_85.text: *But some promises, even the Blade of Frontiers can't keep.*

AvD_55.speaker: Narrator
AvD_55.text: *You clench your eyes tight and leap into darkness. And like always, Mizora follows closely behind.*

AvD_40.speaker: Narrator
AvD_40.text:
|Damn, hard to sleep. Can't stop thinking about everything...
Come dawn, I need to focus on [main goal] - that's the best I can do right now...
...and there's my [Origin concerns] to deal with as well... I need to take my mind off all of this, rest...
...better start counting those stars... zzz|

AvD_72.speaker: Narrator
AvD_72.text: *Rest eludes you as you stare at the wrong side of the stars.*

AvD_63.speaker: Narrator
AvD_63.text: *The ghaik larva is curled up in your skull, no doubt pleased with itself.*

AvD_107.speaker: Narrator
AvD_107.text: *Without a cure, you cannot restore your honour before Vlaakith.*

AvD_21.speaker: Player
AvD_21.text: Contemplate peace. Death can be sought in battle if purification is too far.

AvD_146.speaker: Narrator
AvD_146.text: *You picture a silver blade cleaving through ghaik and their thralls, one after another.*

AvD_74.speaker: Narrator
AvD_74.text: *Every cut is meditation. It reshapes the world to Vlaakith's will.*

AvD_150.speaker: Narrator
AvD_150.text: *Sleep comes as you count the fields of the dead, soon to grow.*

AvD_57.speaker: Narrator
AvD_57.text: *Every day this abomination is in your head, you put others at risk.*

AvD_144.speaker: Narrator
AvD_144.text: *There is no peace in that truth, only an unease that steals away any chance of sleep.*

AvD_224.speaker: Player
AvD_224.text: Rage fills you. Turn the feeling to higher purpose.

AvD_65.speaker: Narrator
AvD_65.text: *Every abomination would be gutted and burned to ash.*

AvD_159.speaker: Narrator
AvD_159.text: *Your anger is clarifying, pure and bright. It burns away all doubt.*

AvD_5.speaker: Narrator
AvD_5.text: *As the fire settles, tension bleeds from your body.*

AvD_133.speaker: Narrator
AvD_133.text: *Tomorrow, you will fight harder than ever before.*

AvD_151.speaker: Narrator
AvD_151.text: *You have been enslaved like your ancestors! Rage sparks to hatred.*

AvD_67.speaker: Narrator
AvD_67.text: *It burns relentlessly, like a red dragon's breath scorching you from the inside out.*

AvD_30.speaker: Narrator
AvD_30.text: *Stripped raw and restless, you find no peace that night.*

AvD_166.speaker: Player
AvD_166.text: Shame claws at you like rot. Are you a failure?

AvD_154.speaker: Narrator
AvD_154.text: *No. You would only be a failure if you stop fighting.*

AvD_197.speaker: Narrator
AvD_197.text: *Your honour can be restored before Vlaakith. It would be restored.*

AvD_43.speaker: Narrator
AvD_43.text: *Resolve strengthened, you fall into a deep slumber.*

AvD_160.speaker: Narrator
AvD_160.text: *You have prepared all your life to fight the ghaik. You dream of presenting one of their vile heads to Vlaakith in Tu'narath!*

AvD_135.speaker: Narrator
AvD_135.text: *How were you caught off-guard on the nautiloid? What was the crucial mistake?*

AvD_123.speaker: Narrator
AvD_123.text: *Without answers, you lay haunted for the rest of the night.*

AvD_170.speaker: Narrator
AvD_170.text: *Gazing up at the night sky, you try to will yourself to sleep.*

AvD_210.speaker: Narrator
AvD_210.text: *Useless - you can't stop thinking of Shar's sacred mission.*

AvD_190.speaker: Narrator
AvD_190.text: *Protect the box. Find your contact in Baldur's Gate. Fulfil Shar's command.*

AvD_84.speaker: Player
AvD_84.text: Reach for the box, hidden among your belongings.

AvD_192.speaker: Narrator
AvD_192.text: *Its weight reassures you. Shar's will and your destiny, right in your grasp.*

AvD_125.speaker: Narrator
AvD_125.text: *So many brothers and sisters sacrificed for it. Only you remain.*

AvD_132.speaker: Narrator
AvD_132.text: *... you and the vile creature inside you. The mere thought of it makes you shiver.*

AvD_42.speaker: Narrator
AvD_42.text: *You have to rid yourself of the tadpole. Shar herself is counting on you.*

AvD_153.speaker: Narrator
AvD_153.text: *If sleep won't come to you, at least darkness will.*

AvD_96.speaker: Player
AvD_96.text: Shut your eyes and silently thank Shar for the night's beauty.

AvD_141.speaker: Narrator
AvD_141.text: *You hear only your own thoughts. Shar's presence won't come to you - why?*

AvD_24.speaker: Narrator
AvD_24.text: *You have fulfilled her will - retrieved the relic for her. Everyone has perished but you.*

AvD_75.speaker: Narrator
AvD_75.text: *... you, and your parasite. You are tainted now. Imperfect.*

AvD_89.speaker: Narrator
AvD_89.text: *You have to rid yourself of the tadpole. Then Shar will come to you - honour you as you honour her.*

AvD_208.speaker: Player
AvD_208.text: Pray to Shar. Her blessing will help you weather the trials ahead.

AvD_48.speaker: Narrator
AvD_48.text: *Only the sounds of the wilderness answer.*

AvD_173.speaker: Player
AvD_173.text: Try to remember what came before the mission.

AvD_180.speaker: Narrator
AvD_180.text: *Your memories are foggy - as your mission requires them to be: Shar's secrets are precious.*

AvD_77.speaker: Narrator
AvD_77.text: *As precious as sleep, and the night's oblivion.*

AvD_121.speaker: Player
AvD_121.text: Let your thoughts turn to the crash.

AvD_124.speaker: Narrator
AvD_124.text: *... all nothing compared to what came before. Compared to the tadpole.*

AvD_163.speaker: Narrator
AvD_163.text: *It's still inside you. Does it watch the night sky even now, through your eyes?*

AvD_101.speaker: Narrator
AvD_101.text: *You have to get rid of it. You have to survive. You are the only one left to ensure Shar's glory.*

AvD_187.speaker: Narrator
AvD_187.text: *The dark is familiar, but not comforting. It is a struggle to sink into your trance, weaving together memory, ambition, and purpose.*

AvD_6.speaker: Narrator
AvD_6.text: *You picture a cup, ancient and elven: priceless. Drinking from it honours the dead - those lost to Lolth's predation.*

AvD_109.speaker: Narrator
AvD_109.text: *Fire spills across your thoughts: dragon's breath. The tadpole slithers, twisting deeper into your skull.*

AvD_134.speaker: Narrator
AvD_134.text: *Your head is about to burst. The memory consumes your mind, corrupting the trance.*

AvD_191.speaker: Player
AvD_191.text: You have walked your dreams countless times before. Will this memory to pass.

AvD_120.speaker: Narrator
AvD_120.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: blood and darkness.*

AvD_145.speaker: Player
AvD_145.text: Refuse to break. Anything can be endured in the trance.

AvD_56.speaker: Narrator
AvD_56.text: *The fire fades, a meaningless distraction. You hold the cup again, ignoring the crack along its belly, and drink.*

AvD_87.speaker: Narrator
AvD_87.text: *As the trance stabilises, your breath deepens. Be it cure or cage, something must be done about the tadpole.*

AvD_59.speaker: Narrator
AvD_59.text: *Every night that passes is another night the monster inside you grows.*

AvD_200.speaker: Narrator
AvD_200.text: *The flames fall away, a mere illusion. You sit the dark again, beside Lolth's majesty.*

AvD_100.speaker: Narrator
AvD_100.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*

AvD_169.speaker: Narrator
AvD_169.text: *Agony bursts behind your eyes, and the whole world goes dark.*

AvD_15.speaker: Narrator
AvD_15.text: *The vision in your mind is simple: a stone altar to Lolth, the knife upon it bloody with sacrifice.*

AvD_218.speaker: Narrator
AvD_218.text: *The day had been a surreal spectacle - scarcely to be comprehended by the sane mind.*

AvD_117.speaker: Player
AvD_117.text: Place a hand over the back of your head, trying to feel the tadpole.

AvD_31.speaker: Narrator
AvD_31.text: *Nothing. Does a tadpole sleep? You tell yourself that's a silly thing to wonder.*

AvD_12.speaker: Narrator
AvD_12.text: *Next you feel a sudden wave of nauseating terror: in seven days you'll be a mind flayer.*

AvD_165.speaker: Narrator
AvD_165.text: *As if you don't have enough problems already...*

AvD_110.speaker: Narrator
AvD_110.text: *No! You refuse to accept it. If there's magic that can hold cities afloat, there has to be magic that can wither a damned tadpole.*

AvD_16.speaker: Narrator
AvD_16.text: *With or without Mystra's help, tomorrow you will find it.*

AvD_115.speaker: Player
AvD_115.text: Foremost in your thoughts is the mind flayer - its unexpected voice.

AvD_88.speaker: Narrator
AvD_88.text: *It had been melodious - soothing even. Not in the most detailed of tomes have you encountered mention of such a thing.*

AvD_198.speaker: Narrator
AvD_198.text: *But you'll know all about it soon enough. In seven days you'll be a mind flayer yourself.*

AvD_47.speaker: Player
AvD_47.text: You recall the dragons. Not even Hell had stopped them.

AvD_129.speaker: Narrator
AvD_129.text: *They were majestic in their fury. Could they too be vanquished by something as small as a tadpole?*

AvD_70.speaker: Narrator
AvD_70.text: *It's a question destined to remain unanswered. In seven days you'll be a mind flayer yourself.*

AvD_94.speaker: Player
AvD_94.text: Shove the images away. You need sleep.

AvD_223.speaker: Narrator
AvD_223.text: *The memories blacken into oblivion, only to be replaced by a number.*

AvD_179.speaker: Narrator
AvD_179.text: *Seven. In seven days you'll be a mind flayer.*

AvD_203.speaker: Narrator
AvD_203.text: *A calm night is a mercy, yet your eyes refuse to stay closed.*

AvD_2.speaker: Narrator
AvD_2.text: *Every time they flicker shut, the tadpole seems to twitch behind them.*

AvD_35.speaker: Narrator
AvD_35.text: *Dragons, gith, and the Hells themselves have come after you. Yet it is this creature that lingers in your skull.*

AvD_130.speaker: Player
AvD_130.text: Focus. Finding a cure is all that matters.

AvD_60.speaker: Narrator
AvD_60.text: *And you will find it, no matter the cost.*

AvD_207.speaker: Narrator
AvD_207.text: *Your life is your own. No wriggling tadpole is going to change that.*

AvD_212.speaker: Narrator
AvD_212.text: *Sleep claims you, determination buoyed by gentle dreams.*

AvD_137.speaker: Player
AvD_137.text: You have to learn to control the tadpole. It's dangerous, but powerful.

AvD_213.speaker: Narrator
AvD_213.text: *All you have to do is turn the tables - cage the creature before it cages you.*

AvD_86.speaker: Narrator
AvD_86.text: *You wonder if it could hear these thoughts - if it knows you're planning a rebellion.*

AvD_49.speaker: Narrator
AvD_49.text: *Let it listen. You will dream of all the ways to make this power your own.*

AvD_142.speaker: Player
AvD_142.text: Force the tadpole out of your mind. Think of home instead.

AvD_194.speaker: Narrator
AvD_194.text: *You belong with your people, down in the dark that never fades.*

AvD_97.speaker: Narrator
AvD_97.text: *Your people have survived the drow, the duergar, and every monster the Underdark has to offer. A mind flayer is nothing.*

AvD_22.speaker: Narrator
AvD_22.text: *Under the strange and open sky, sleep claims you.*

AvD_138.speaker: Narrator
AvD_138.text: *Yet the tadpole is in the dark too. Dozens of them, crawling towards you as a mind flayer held your skull in its psionic grip.*

AvD_36.speaker: Narrator
AvD_36.text: *Disgust churns deep in your stomach, leaving you resigned to a night without sleep.*

AvD_53.speaker: Player
AvD_53.text: Force the tadpole out of your mind. Think of home instead.

AvD_25.speaker: Narrator
AvD_25.text: *Baldur's Gate feels almost like a dream, after everything that has happened to you.*

AvD_38.speaker: Narrator
AvD_38.text: *Yet it is a dream of hope. You may be countless miles away, but it isn't an impossible journey.*

AvD_44.speaker: Narrator
AvD_44.text: *You will see those gates again. That promise sinks deep into your heart as your eyes drift shut.*

AvD_76.speaker: Narrator
AvD_76.text: *Except all you can picture is citizens with their skulls splintering open, tentacles sprouting from broken mouths.*

AvD_98.speaker: Narrator
AvD_98.text: *Their empty, alien eyes haunt you through a night of fitful sleep.*

AvD_103.speaker: Player
AvD_103.text: The tadpole influences you. Perhaps you might influence it in return...

AvD_219.speaker: Narrator
AvD_219.text: *You focus on that spot of pain from when it slipped behind your eye, to where it now lurks.*

AvD_214.speaker: Narrator
AvD_214.text: *You cannot prod it, but you can make it clear that you are watching. What is there to fear when it is the one stuck inside you?*

AvD_139.speaker: Narrator
AvD_139.text: *It is a minor victory, but enough to soothe you to sleep.*

AvD_136.speaker: Narrator
AvD_136.text: *The thought is punished by a spike of pain driven right between your eyes.*

AvD_209.speaker: Narrator
AvD_209.text: *The agony refuses to fade until you collapse against your bedroll in a cold sweat.*

AvD_216.speaker: Narrator
AvD_216.text: *You try to rest, but your mind won't settle.*
AvD_216.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lying on his side, turns to lie on back

AvD_222.speaker: Narrator
AvD_222.text: *Just yesterday you were seducing a young noble, luring him to your master's lair.*

AvD_78.speaker: Narrator
AvD_78.text: *Today? You'd been kidnapped by mind flayers, chased through Hell by dragons, and thrown out of a burning ship.*

AvD_95.speaker: Narrator
AvD_95.text: *And you felt the sun on your skin...*

AvD_211.speaker: Player
AvD_211.text: Recall the light's comforting warmth. It's been an eternity.

AvD_90.speaker: Narrator
AvD_90.text: *You wonder if your ability to walk in the sun is a side effect of the tadpole the mind flayer put in your eye. It must be?*

AvD_23.speaker: Narrator
AvD_23.text: *All you know for sure is, given time, it will turn you into one of them.*

AvD_58.speaker: Narrator
AvD_58.text: *Getting rid of the tadpole will mean returning to the darkness. Unless...*

AvD_39.speaker: Narrator
AvD_39.text: *... unless you understand it. Master it. Which means finding an expert.*

AvD_54.speaker: Player
AvD_54.text: Focus on the problem - who would know the most about this?

AvD_164.speaker: Narrator
AvD_164.text: *You mentally shuffle through places likely to have an expert in mind flayers. Candlekeep? Neverwinter? Menzoberranzan? Baldur's Gate...*

AvD_113.speaker: Narrator
AvD_113.text: *Baldur's Gate is close to your master's coven, but also home to amazing scholars. Still, that's a problem for the morning.*
AvD_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

AvD_108.speaker: Narrator
AvD_108.text: *You try to focus, but all you can see are the menacing eyes of a mind flayer.*

AvD_177.speaker: Player
AvD_177.text: Roll over, push it all from your mind.

AvD_66.speaker: Narrator
AvD_66.text: *You think on the day. The sunshine. Being alive - more or less.*

AvD_62.speaker: Narrator
AvD_62.text: *Despite everything, you relax into peaceful meditation, satisfied with all that's happened. Perhaps you wouldn't sleep so well if you knew what was coming.*

AvD_80.speaker: Player
AvD_80.text: Close your eyes. Relax. Imagine dragging your old master into the sunlight.

AvD_46.speaker: Narrator
AvD_46.text: *You smile, meditating on the flames that engulf his cruel face.*
AvD_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

AvD_174.speaker: Narrator
AvD_174.text: *You close your eyes and try to focus on his delightful screams, but they quickly turn into your own. They only stop when tentacles burst from your mouth.*

AvD_175.speaker: Narrator
AvD_175.text: *You shudder, resigning yourself to whatever dark rest awaits you.*

AvD_50.speaker: Player
AvD_50.text: Think about your master. He'll be furious you didn't bring him dinner.

AvD_189.speaker: Narrator
AvD_189.text: *He'll believe you if you tell him what happened. But he won't forgive.*

AvD_64.speaker: Narrator
AvD_64.text: *Of course - you might already be a mind flayer by the time you return to Cazador.*

AvD_116.speaker: Narrator
AvD_116.text: *You could try getting rid of the tadpole, but that probably means returning to the darkness. Unless...*

AvD_205.speaker: Player
AvD_205.text: Consider the tadpole. Can a vampire spawn even become a mind flayer?

AvD_73.speaker: Narrator
AvD_73.text: *The worm in your head might not even have an appetite for undead meat.*

AvD_193.speaker: Narrator
AvD_193.text: *Until you know more about the tadpole, you can't be sure how much danger you're in.*

AvD_7.speaker: Narrator
AvD_7.text: *You have to understand it. Master it. Which means you need to find an expert.*
